CONJUGATES: ink (plural noun) | inks (3rd person singular present) | inked (past tense, past participle) | inking (present participle)
ETYMOLOGY: From Old French encre (modern French encre), from Latin encaustum 'purple ink used by Roman emperors', from Ancient Greek ἔγκαυστον (enkauston), neuter of ἔγκαυστος (enkaustos) 'burnt in' (from ἐγκαίειν (enkaiein) 'to burn in').

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A colored fluid or paste used for writing, drawing, printing, or copying.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 用于书写、绘画、印刷或复制的彩色液体或糊状物。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She accidentally spilled blue ink all over the important document.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她不小心把蓝色墨水洒在了重要文件上。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A dark liquid ejected by squid and octopuses as a defense mechanism or camouflage.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 乌贼和章鱼为防御或伪装而喷射的黑色液体。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The octopus squirted a cloud of black ink to confuse its attacker.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 章鱼喷出一团黑墨汁以迷惑攻击者。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word used to describe an action, state, or occurrence.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To cover, mark, or draw with ink.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 用墨水覆盖、标记或绘画。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The tattoo artist carefully inked the intricate design onto her arm.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 纹身师小心翼翼地将复杂的图案纹到她的手臂上。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word used to describe an action, state, or occurrence.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To sign a contract or document, especially formally or decisively.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 签署合同或文件，尤指正式或果断地签署。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: After months of negotiation, both parties finally inked the deal.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 经过数月的谈判，双方最终签署了协议。
